descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Analytical methods for environmental engineers. Laboratory methods and interpretation of results for the chemical analyses of water samples.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Section 20, Section for CivEnv Seniors

Section 21, Graduate Student Section

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will attain the following outcomes through objectives listed in brackets:

1 to learn basic chemistry and microbiology laboratory skills used by environmental engineers for assessing the microbial and chemical quality of a water sample

2 to learn how to determine microbial abundance and to apply staining techniques to differentiate microorganisms

3 to learn how to determine concentrations of key chemical species

4 to be able to plan and conduct and experiment

5 to be able to effectively report, analyze and interpret laboratory results

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
For the undergraduate section 20, using this textbook: The Art and Science of Chemical Analysis / Christie G. Enke / ISBN: 978-0471373698 / 2000 / Wiley

For the graduate section 21, no formal textbook is required.
